Body: I have the IBM tutorial on using Arduino+Bluemix
column9: up and running. I would now like to take a decision on the cloud and let the Arduino subscribe to a topic containing the decision message. For this
column10: I am trying to use the IBM IOT out node in my Node-RED editor. However
column11:
I am not sure of how to configure this node.

Are there any tutorials that cover this use-case (IBM IOT out node + Arduino
column12:
MQTT)- or documentation on the node properties?

Thanks. NK

"

Body: You need to configure the IBM IoT out node to publish messages to the device ID of your Arduino. The msg.payload will be the message you send to your Arduino. You will also need to set the topic as well, the topic contains your deviceId also. Then you will need to have your Arduino subscribe to the topic to receive the messages.

Thanks - but an example/snapshot would be greatly appreciated. Snapshot of the IBM IOT out node configuration and also of the client side code (Arduino?) if possible. OR link to IBM documentation that describes how to configure - I could not find relevant IBM documentation on my own.

This is the picture of an IoT output node I'm using on the Coursera IoT course, works for me sending data to the Sense HAT device plugged onto my pi.

At the client side I'm using NodeRED (using a Pi this is easy :-) and an IoT input node which does the subscription to the command.

The docs describe how to subscribe to commands HERE under the heading Subscribing to Commands.

The subscription topic should look like iot-2/cmd/[command_id]/fmt/[format_string]
column9: so for my pi to subscribe to the command in the picture the topic should be iot-2/cmd/display/fmt/json - although I haven't tried that myself
column10:
it should work.

"
